Reviews.Title: “Neighborhood feel, but not in the heart of downtown”
Reviews.Author: TrippyAG
Reviews.Content: No complaints-- value for money this hotel was totally reasonable. It was clean, had a/c, good sized rooms (for IT) modern bathrooms, decent breakfast option, was in a nice/safe neighborhood, and was close to the metro. That said, it's not in the heart of Rome-- don't expect a view or to stroll to the Spanish Steps. But with distance comes value. While I wouldn't call it a 'budget' hotel (it's nicer than that), it's definitely budget friendlier than the downtown hotels. Rome's metro and bus system is easy to use and reliable, so it's really not THAT far from the action.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Down!!”
Reviews.Author: ajforty
Reviews.Content: I find it hard to believe those who rate this a quality hotel. The general consensus was that the staff was not very accommodating or friendly. They did not try to do anything to make your stay pleasant. Asked for but could not get an extra pillow 2 nights in a row. When asked something, it was like, "don't bother me". The room was small and the beds not comfortable. Did not even have amenities like tissues in the room. Asked for wake-up call for 8:30 AM; got call at 8:05. It was far from the main tourist attractions and taxis were not readily available as in the main areas of the city. No bar or restaurant. Metro was at least quarter of a mile away. Where most hotels provide free internet service you need to pay 5 Euros for 1 hour, when the signal is working. If you want to be where there are attractions, don't stay there. If you want a quiet area, just a place to sleep, don't need any help with anything, and no amenities, then this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bum_fluff1264
Reviews.Content: We booked with hotel through thomas cook. It is a lovely quiet hotel about 30 minute walk outside Rome. The hotel is 3 storey with lots of tall rooms. Unfortunatly our room did not have a bath as it said on the site. Free safe in the room with a nice sized fridge. The bed was nice and comfy and a good size. Shower was lovely and hot. The staff were helpful but didn't seem that friendly which I assumed because they spoke little to no english. Continental breakfast was included. Fresh bread, yogarts and cereal were available. The only downside (in my opinion) to the hotel is that there was only local restaurants around. Some local seemed rude and wouldn't serve us 5 minutes before opening times. However, some places we went to were fantastic. The Policimini (not sure of spelling) metro station is about 6/7 minute walk from the hotel. The roads near the hotel are busy , as they are in rome itself. The Roma Pass (25 euros) will get you on the metro free. Stops including the collesium, spanish steps and Vatican City.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: LatinaViva
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. Our room was on the first floor. The room itself was big enough. Only the bathroom was very small. Two persons did not fit in. The hairdryer in the bathroom did not deserve to be called hairdryer. The breakfast buffet offered something for everyone. Cereals, cake, fruits, bread, eggs, sausages. If we had questions, the hotel stuff was always very helpful. After check-out we could leave our luggage in the hotel. They putted a number on the luggage and gave us a paper with this number. This was a good feeling that the luggage would be safe. Although there was this small bathroom I would book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: lvan046
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1) Air conditioning worked 2) Safe and quiet location Cons: 1) No minibar in room- was told to use the hotel bar, which is never open 2) Power failures- 5 of them, left us in darkness, and sweltering heat since aircon stopped working 3) Television did not work at all- asked for it to be fixed, and of course nothing happened 4) Room smelled horrible- as soon as we entered our room, it reeked, the entire 7 days we were in it 5) Reception desk was ALWAYS busy, whether with business or staff just chatting amongst themselves- asking any directions or questions was a hassle unless you dont mind waiting for the staff to finish their chats. 6) One of the staff did not even look like he wanted to be at front desk- he was very cold, unhelpful, and had a real attitude. We would ask him for an internet code, and he would just continue clicking away on his computer without any acknowledgement of us apart from throwing a screwed up piece of paper with our code on it at us. 7) Had to ask for toilet paper at reception, rather than it being supplied by the room cleaners 8) Cleaners are very noisy in the morning and WILL wake you 9) Very noisy as we were next to the elevator and could hear the people on floor above us 10) Small insects in our room that looked like fleas- dont know how they got in since we never opened our window 11) Internet access is only available from one room in the hotel Either they are handing out hotel stars like candy or this is the new standard, but in my experience this is NOT a 4 star hotel. Fortunately this did not ruin our trip to Rome but we will not be staying here again unless it was free.

Reviews.Title: “You could do a lot worse”
Reviews.Author: Crystal007
Reviews.Content: Possibly not 4* but on the whole we found this hotel to be good. After exeperiencing the city centre, we were so glad thishotel was in a quiet area so there were no problems at night. Hotel was clean, staff were friendly and helpful and althogh rooms are small, they are adequate. It is a city hotel after all and not a resort. You are a couple of minutes walk from the bus station and four stops to the termini in the city centre. there is also a nice park just over the road if you want to "chill out" for an hour or so. Breakfast was good although bear in mind it is a continental hotel so the bacon is "continental style"and no doubt the scrambled egg is made from powdered egg but there are plenty of other items from which to choose. Restaurants and shops about 5-10 mins away. My only "complaint" was the mini bar fridge did not appear to be working but as we did not really use it anyway, I did not even bother to report it. On the whole I thought it was good value for money and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “3 stars maximum”
Reviews.Author: rebrand
Reviews.Content: We payed 70 euros per night and that is the top that someone should pay for it. The neighborhood is nice but far from the center. The room was small and the breakfast disappointing. The hotel has 4 stars on its sign, but it is definitely not a 4 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel would definitely stay again next time.......”
Reviews.Author: wcricket123
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the prime hotel villa torlonia last week 12/03/2010, and what a great place..... breakfast and staff very nice.....location is great, set in a lovely quiet area, next to a beautiful park(villa torlonia).....tube station is 100 metres away and is so easy to use and arrive roughly every 5 mins....... if you want to get to the vatican, make sure you hop on the number 62 castillo st angello, it takes you right outside........cant wait to go back.......

Reviews.Title: “A very good deal”
Reviews.Author: NTIcedCoffee
Reviews.Content: We scored this hotel on one of the short notice websites (might have been Wotif or Lastminute) and it ticked all the right boxes for us: great price (50 or 60EUR per night between Xmas and New Year); clean; nice neighbourhood that was close to city centre and tourist highlights but far enough away to be representative of the actual foreign country we're visiting. It was no problem reaching the hotel from Termini with luggage. We walked to the Metro, waited 5 min, caught the train the two stops (another 5 min) and then walked for less than 5min from Policlinico (nearest Metro station) to the hotel - easy! Room (double) was almost new from refurbishment, bathroom large and everything was clean. The actual area the hotel is in is still the city of Rome, but it's a fairly residential suburb so not action central. There were a number of Embassies and Consulates nearby, which should give a fairly positive indication of the nature of the area. Vatican (and a guest appearance by Senator Palpatine! from one of the windows too), Colosseum, City centre were all close at hand via the Metro. Service fine, typical continental breakfast included and WiFi in the room: I'd stay there again without a moments hesitation. Even got in a round of golf in Rome (at Parco de Medici which was a ridiculously overpriced goat track, but that's another story).

Reviews.Title: “elegant and quiet”
Reviews.Author: silvy023
Reviews.Content: Clean and well decorated. Very limited breakfast choice (mostly things full of sugar). Single rooms are extremely small (feels like a part of corridor). Easy to reach airport by metro.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, dont listen to bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: spencerf
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a short visit to rome. the hotel is located in a beautiful neighborhood with very nice mediterranean architecture. it is a block from the metro which brings you into the center of rome in 2 stops including termini station and the colloseum. the hotel is small but very clean. the rooms hotel staff speak english perfectly. the rooms are not small and are actually quite roomy and have a luxurious feel to them. it is one of the cleanest hotels ive stayed in while in europe. the air conditioning is very good compared to the rest of europe. the hotel has a computer with internet which costs 5 euro for an hour or 12 euro for 24 hours. there is also wifi but only in the lobby for the same price. the hotel had a very good breakfast buffet which is at no extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special - but O.K!”
Reviews.Author: P0P0LA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with my boyfriend. The hotel is O.K - rooms were clean, but a little small. Breakfast was nice. Quiet neighbourhood - location wasn't exactly great, but it's not hard to get to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “I expected a little more from this place.”
Reviews.Author: freekarma
Reviews.Content: It is not the our stay at this hotel was horrible, or even bad for that matter. It was...more of a disappointment. I guess I had expected more after both perusing reviews on this site and other travel sites. First, the things about this hotel I did enjoy. Location was actually quite good. It was about a 5 minute walk to the closest metro station (policlinico) which could get you to most places you needed to go. The breakfast selection was excellent, although it was quite busy the times I went down and the employees working the dining room always seemed flustered by this. I think it was a bit under staffed for the number of patrons sitting down to breakfast. The location was nice as it was a fairly quiet area of Rome and did not deal with outside disturbances too often. As for the list of things that made our stay a bit of a disappointment, here is the list. Employees - not the most personable, and this was not due to language barrier. We could walk in and out of the lobby without any sort of acknowledgement of our presence. The rooms could've been cleaner. The fabric covered walls had perm. water stains on them. The shower was tiny. I've stayed in enough european hotels to know that things tend to run on the smallish side, but we're talking tiny by even these standards. One last thing, we had an item go missing from our room. We didn't necessarily suspect theft, but it took several days for this to get resolved by the reception/management.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Ruined My Vacation and Rome..THEFT”
Reviews.Author: slickdealmike
Reviews.Content: While staying at this hotle are room was broken into and my wifes Iphone stolen. Also in the same night the fire alarm would not stop going off. The next morning we spent finding a new hotel and making police reports. We were only there for 3 days and were on a tight schedule. Because of this hotel we missed one of our tours. If you want to have a good vacation with no problems don't stay here. The location is horrible also and will take you atleat 20-25 mintues each way by train to get to all the sites. Worst time I ever had on vacation. Read other reviews on this site and google and you will see a lot of people had there stuff stolen while they were at this hotel. There was also another man in the lobby complaining that he had his notebook stolen the same night my phone was stolen. DON'T TAKE THE CHANCE!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and friendly”
Reviews.Author: StephColex
Reviews.Content: Good location, a few minutes walk from Policlinico Metro station. Staff are very friendly and as soon as we got there were quite happy to spend a good 15 minutes telling us places to go for food, places to avoid, how to get around by public transport etc and provided us with a very useful map. The buffet breakfast was fine although we did find they weren't too quick at replacing food once it had gone! Room was adequate and very clean, although we had one of the underground rooms which only had a small window at the very top. This wasn't ideal, but the room was nice and cool because of it! There's a pleasant little courtyard in the hotel too that was nice to sit out in. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others if looking for a cheap city break.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Dublin_doll_15
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother for 5 days in early May. The location is convenient for reaching the city centre and the rooms are clean but they are the only positives. The staff were rude and didn't even bother to put the phone down while they checked us in. Instead they gestured for our paperwork and handed us a key. There are no facilities near this hotel and you have to go into the city if you want to eat. We came from Dublin into Ciampino and I picked this hotel as it's billed as the 'historical area' but it's not classed as the city so a taxi from the airport was 65 euro and this was at 9pm at night. Hotel's within the city walls have a flat fare from the airport of 30 euro. This hotel is also very noisy. The whole place has laminate floors so anyone walking around late at night will wake the whole floor. Also, the hotel is very close to a hospital so you get the ambulance sirens several times a night. I throughly enjoyed my stay in Rome and will return but next time I will stick to the Spanish Steps or Via Vento area as these are more central.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in worse”
Reviews.Author: grantmac
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Villa Torlonia as it was close to, and recommended by, a language school I was attending. It is a little bit out of the centre, but has very good tube and bus links to wherever you want to get too. Nearest Metro station is Policlinico. I had a back room and a friend had one facing the street. She barely got a wink of sleep. due to traffic noise. There is a fairly major road a couple of hundred metres away. The back room was much quieter, although the walls are paper thin and you can easily hear conversations in neighbouring rooms. Rooms are pleasant, modern and reasonably comfortable although my bathroom could have done with a bit of work - hairdryer hanging off the wall (I'm bald, so not really an issue) and a shower drain that needed attention. There was a safe in the room, which was a relief and security seemed OK generally. Breakfast was good, although the glasses were plastic which jarred with the ambience which they had otherwise managed to create. The biggest problem with the hotel was the staff. They are overworked and consequently under pressure all the time resulting in poor customer service, although one or two of them were very pleasant and helpful. And don't expect the manager to be there to resolve things either. He is responsible for 3 hotels so doesn't spend too much time at Torlonia. The Prime Group, owners of the hotel are clearly trying to cust costs and it shows. This is not an expensive hotel and is fine as long as your expectations are right. It is rated as a 4 star. I would give it 3 at most but would use it again and would recommend it to friends but would make sure that I had managed their expectations first

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: averell23
Reviews.Content: As I came for another business trip, I simply selected one of the cheaper hotels in the area where the venue was, and I wasn't disappointed. Could be that the cheap price was an off-season offer, I saw that at other times I'd have paid several times as much. In any case, for the price that I paid it was a really nice Hotel. The room was fairly standard and clean. The staff was nice enough and the breakfast was half-decent. Just stay away from the toxic sludge they pass off as juices, and you'll be fine. Thinking of it, the ham&egg wasn't really worth a try, either. The neighbourhood is nice, quiet and seems quite safe even at night, and Termini station can be reached in 10 minutes by bus. As for your valuables (since at has been mentioned before): There are no safes in the rooms; the staff at the reception didn't have a problem keeping my bag for me, but they didn't lock it in. Not for jewels, but safer than the room. There's a wireless internet connection, but "at this time" it only reaches the lobby and no rooms beyond the 1st floor, I was told. For that reason I didn't bother to try.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Prime Hotel Villa Torlonia”
Reviews.Author: fuzzy0duck
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights here in Dec '08. It has a very convenient location; only two stops from the Termini and on the same line as the Colloseum stop. The tram also stops just outside the hotel, and the hotel itself is a few minute walk from the Policlinico stop. Check in was prompt and the receptionist was very friendly and helpful. Luckily enough, we got quite a sizeable room which was also very clean, and had big windows with blinds. Bathroom was a bit on the small side though. Would be nice if there was a bathtub though! Can't speak for the breakfast as we chose to have breakfast on our own in the city. Overall, we were both very happy with the service and accommodation we received. Wouldn't mind staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “good location, miserable staff!”
Reviews.Author: FergieShropshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 29 oct - 1 nov.The location is good, being close to bus, tram and metro. Rooms are small but clean, beds comfortable, toiletries and towels replaced daily.breakfast is good -mostly continental plus scrambled egg and bacon. Overall good value for money paid for hotel in Rome. On minus side staff are miserable - cant say they were rude as they didnt actually acknowledge your presence! Dont rely on bar as all the time we were there it was closed as they said they had no staff to run it! However they didnt say anything when we bought our own alcohol and used their glasses, although, come to think about it, there were no staff arount to say anything! One thing , ladies, dont rely on their hairdrier - it is like a hose coming out of wall which became too hot to hold and is totally inadequate. We went with a group of friends and some didnt work at all! Adding to previous comments there is now a note in room saying hotel will not be held responsible for any items stolen from room but there is a general safe for everybody use in reception. Having read earlier post we didnt take any valuables with us and kept our passports with us at all times and also kept room keys - we removed key from brass holder.

Reviews.Title: “Burgled”
Reviews.Author: HolidayKiwis
Reviews.Content: IF CONSIDERING STAYING AT HOTEL PRIME VILLA TORLONIA PLEASE READ THIS WARNING We stayed at Hotel Prime Villa Torlonia for four days early in October, 2008 at the end of a two month holiday through England and Europe. On the evening of October 7th, we went out for an evening meal around 8pm, locking our 2nd floor hotel room and leaving the key at reception, as it had a very heavy brass attachment and could not fit into a pocket. Returning a couple of hours later we picked up the key from reception and unlocked our room door, only to discover that our locked suitcase had had its zip prised open. Our money in various currencies and stored in different parts of the suitcase had been stolen, as well as jewellery and our digital camera with the cards containing the past month’s photos. There was no sign of forced entry so someone must have had a key to get into our room. We reported this to reception only to find that two other couples from the fourth floor had been similarly burgled. The police were called and had a cursory look around the room, and told us to go to the Police Station the following day to make out a report. The following morning we and the other couples were asked to wait for the Manager to arrive (eventually around 10.30). He took down details of items stolen together with our email and telephone numbers and told us he would be contacting his head office to see what assistance Prime Hotels could offer. As we were staying on for a further two days he promised to see us before we left. That was the last we saw or heard from him or any other official, in spite of requests to reception and emails sent to him after our arrival back home in New Zealand a week ago. The security and customer service at this hotel regarding burglary from their clients’ rooms was abysmal. • The hotel room was locked with no signs of forced of entry. • The keys are at the side, not behind the reception desk and are easily available to anyone. • There were no safes in the hotel rooms, and no information about safe deposit was available. • Their video surveillance was totally inadequate. In short, if you’re thinking about staying at this hotel, then do yourself a favour and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Valuables not safe here”
Reviews.Author: SFT20
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here three nights in early Oct 08. The staff was generally unfriendly, but we chose to ignore it as we wanted to focus on having a great time in Rome. However, the morning we were checking out, we discovered that someone had broken into our room and stolen our video camera and my husband's watch. When I went to the desk to notify them, two other couples were in the middle of reporting their thefts as well. Luckily, there situation was much worse. The staff seemed bothered to have to deal with the three couples, and basically shrugged their shoulders as if to say, "too bad". You think they would have been concerned. Terrible hotel, would not recommened this to ANYONE.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at villa Torlonia”
Reviews.Author: LeffeBoy
Reviews.Content: Had a good 4 night stay at this hotel in early October. As previous reviews have stated it is away from the centre, but we found that it was a nice 20-30 minute walk to the major sights each day. That meant we got to see many interesting sights (and a wide variety of authority uniforms) on the way. Our room was compact, but very clean and tidy. Breakfast was varied and well presented. Finally, reception staff were friendly and approachable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: NickT79
Reviews.Content: Villa Torlonia seemed pretty good value. It wasn't expensive, and correspondingly the room wasn't amazing. It was big, with plenty of space and high ceilings. When we first arrived the shower didn't drain away properly, but it was fixed first thing in the morning. The wireless internet in the lobby didn't work during our 5 day stay. The staff were friendly and helpful, offering suggestions for dinner and places to visit. The hotel is not far from the Policlinico metro stop - try to avoid a taxi as they charge €25 for a €2 metro journey!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Not To Expensive Hotel In Rome”
Reviews.Author: NaviDominik
Reviews.Content: We really liked our stay at Prime hotel Villa Torlonia in Rome. The room was big enough with TV, AC, ensuite bathroom, and the price was more than o.k. 160,00 Euros for 2 people - per 3 nights.Breakfast was more than good and it was included into the price. We arrived quite early and before check-in time, but that was not a problem. Staff was very friendly and multi lingual. They helpped us with our luggage, explained how to get to the center and we could pick any of the rooms that was availbale. It is on a 5 minutes walking distance from the metro and 2 metro stations from Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - few issues”
Reviews.Author: emily1982
Reviews.Content: Positive Points Great Area - Felt safe, good value restaurants (the nearby Chinese was especially good - we'd been in Italy nearly a month and were kind of over Pizza and Pasta). Nearby Gelletaria excellent too. 2 mins walk to Metro, 20 mins walk to Trivi Fountain/Spanish Steps, can reach Vatican 10 mins on tram, Colosseum 8 mins on Metro. Villa Borghese 20 min walk. Breakfast reasonable. Room acceptable (See our story below) Staff mostly good (Staff helped us reserve the tickets for museum Borghese - a must see!) Negative Points Room small (See below our story) SKY TV in Main Room only Cleaner didn't replace toiletries on 2nd/3rd day (the hotel shampoo is really nice as well : ( We used LATE ROOMS Staff not calling late rooms (As above ... We didn't take mobile and didn't want to pay loads from room phone) Our Story: We booked through Laterooms, and authorised a price of 178 euro for 3 nights, the receipt came back with a price of 206 euros. I have booked many things through the internet and have never seen a confirmed price change once you put in your credit card details. The hotel offered no help and took 206 Euros off of us. We were initially put in a 'suite' near the garage however after one night of twin beds (We requested a double being a couple) no carpets and paper thin walls we asked to change after some persuasion we were given a room in the main building which was more comfortable for us and had a double bed. However the room was very small and so was the bathroom still we much preferred this room and it felt much closer to the standard you would expect for a 4* in terms of decor.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: cliveasmith
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in August and were very happy with the hotel for the price we paid, about £370 for 2 rooms. The rooms were clean and modern. The TV was only in Italian though so if you can't understand you have had it. It is only a short walk to the metro, so getting around is no problem. The breakfast was fine, plenty to eat and the room was very nice. The only down side for us was that the shower was very small and the water would not stay at an constant temp. Our room overlooked the courtyard and was smaller than our son's room which looked out to the street, so they must all be different sizes. As for noise from the road, there was none to talk of, don't know if we were lucky but others on here have said they heard sirens all the time, we didn't.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Ozzie00
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for couple of nights and have to say it was great. The location is not too bad as the metro station is only short walk from the hotel. There is a big park near the hotel as well. Breakfast was also OK as were the rooms. We were lucky to get the parking in the garage inside the property which was great as the driving in Rome is a nightmare. We were using metro instead which took us to all major attractions. Sometimes we had to change lanes but it was no big deal. We bought daily tickets (unlimited) for 4 euros and didn't have to worry about transport.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ljwitt
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews, we felt the need to give our view on this fab hotel!! This was mine (19years old) and my boyfriends (22years old) first holiday away together without my parents! Getting to the hotel itself was such a pain after we realised the metro station would have taken us there with no effort at all! This was our fault for not checking the metro map and instead walking there which took at least 30mins so if you are going, catch the metro after the train to Policinio (cant remember how you spell it!) Once we arrived though, the male receptionist was extremely helpful. He gave us a cartoony map of the city and marked the places of interest (Colosseum, Vatican City etc.) and where we would get off the metro. We constantly asked him for his help and he was always willing. Breakfast was a typical continental breakfast but plenty of food for all. The english tourists were very pleasant and the waitresses did their best to speak to us but spoke little english, yet always polite. The room was fantastic! After booking, we saw the pictures of the old green style rooms and were then disappointed, but on arrival we had a gorgeous room with adequate space, a huge double bed and lovely balcony over looking other hotels. None can be a 'city view' as this hotel is too far out and does not overlook the city, simply the side streets which are still pleasant. Went to a local pastry shop 5minutes away a few times which did the best chocolate croissants we have had! This hotel is great for those who want quiet in the evening but is still incredibly close to the action and attractions via the metro for whenever you need. Police sirens were quite regular though which did wake us a couple of times yet there was police every where we went, in and outside the city centre. We had been warned of pick-pocketers but were always aware of our hand luggage and luckily never experienced any. Eventhough this did not happen to us, we were always weary and never took more euros than we needed. Colosseum is ridiculously cheap for EU citizens so make sure you take your driving licence or passport with you. For people under 16 (i think!) it is free, and discount is for those between 17 and 26. Vatican City was expensive as we opted for the tour but the only thing we splashed out on and thoroughly enjoyed it. Would recommend. As i said, out first holiday away together and was definatly a success. Hotel was fab and Rome is certainly a romantic city! Perfect for couples of any age, probably not the best for large families as quite basic. Hope this helps! Please believe me, i am very fussy and was very happy and surprised with the outcome of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for centre Rome”
Reviews.Author: pompeypaulo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well placed for getting into central Rome though jandy enough out to avoid the busstle.There is a metro station just 5 mins walk round the corner and there are at least 7 or 8 decent restaurants all within a 5 min walk. The hotel is clean and well appointed with a nice little garden at the back with a real lemon tree in it with real lemons on it! Amazing. The brekky was savage, real coolio, especially the scrambled egg and the ham, though the good selection of croisants was a winner especially the chocolate! The noise around Rome is high anyway mainly due to the incessant row of the ambulance sirens being left on all the time! Though it adds to the experience, the hotel is set in a quiet back street surrounded by nice embassys and very well appointed villas. Basically it is the bizz and we would return there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: Noeyedeer
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night break at this hotel. Together with my wife and fourteen year old daughter, we had a very pleasant stay. The room was above average in size, even with the third bed. Looked as though recently decorated, so all very clean and fresh. As other reviewers have pointed out, a slight distance away from the city centre, so catching a metro every morning was unavoidable, but station only 350m away, so no big drama in that. My only slight grumbles were ... The internet connection was down the whole time I was there. Got rather stuffy on a couple of nights, but the air con did not function, so I had to open the window, which in turn let all the usual city noise in. The breakfast self serving area was slighly small, so it got a bit crowded when at peak times (8.45 - 9.00) and the breakfast did not quite hit the mark for me. eg fresh orange juice was at an additional charge ! But as previously mentioned only minor issues. I would definately reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very quite”
Reviews.Author: Sweety1111
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean and quite. Just outside the city but not far from the main attraction. Its about 5minutes walk from Metro Policlinico (line B). We stayed in the ground floor which had small window but didn’t bother us because we were out of the hotel by 8am. Room had the basic facilities, stand in shower, wash basin & toilet, tv, dressing table, small wardrobe and phone. The only thing I didn’t like is the bed, they put together 2 single beds instead of double bed. I don’t know anything about this neighbourhood but it was pretty quite during the weekend and saw few people moving about around weekdays.

Reviews.Title: “Safe and quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Mianel
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4-night stay at Villa Tornolia at the beginning of March 2008. The hotel is located outside the city centre in a safe and nice neighborhood with beautiful old villas. It is amazingly quiet, but the disadvantage is a 20 minutes walk to the area of Termini station. I had to be at Sapienza University, which is on walking distance, and this was the reason to choose this hotel. If I would go as a tourist I probably would choose a hotel closer to the main touristic sites. The room was small but with a balcony and the interior was nice, seemed to be renovated recently, impressive heigh ceiling, internet worked without any problems. Staff at the front desk was helpful and speaks English. The hotel offers a good continental breakfast but there is no dinner restaurant. However, at the main street you will find several restaurants (10 minutes walk). Tip: if you arrive with two persons at airport Roma Ciampino the fixed price by taxi to this part of the city is only EUR 30.00. This is cheaper than 2 bus tickets to Termini plus a taxi form Termini to the hotel and much faster. So don't buy tickets for the Ryanair bus that are offered during the flight by the flight attendants.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: annirene
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 4 nights after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. Felt I had to convey our thoughts as you so often only hear bad things about accommodation. This is a great middle priced hotel, we paid approx. £40 per night B&B for a single room each (there were three of us) we all had a shower ensuite, plenty of fluffy white towels, hot water and sheets changed twice during our stay and rooms kept extremely clean. Paintwork and net curtains beginning to show signs of wear but as this was so early in the season they may have been about to rectify this in their pre season touch up. Breakfast was continental (plus bacon and scrambled eggs) and was plentiful. Staff courteous and pleasant at all times even though our Italian was less than rudimentary. Free use of the internet on a first come first served basis, I had no problem checking my emails every day. The 300 metre walk to the Metro takes a few minutes and it is only 2 stops to Termini and connections to buses, trains, tour buses and walking tours. Couldn't be better. Would go back tomorrow and I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: NicClaudia
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short vacation in Rome. Hotel Villa Torlonia has a great location and very nice rooms. If peace, tranquility and green space is what you wish for, Villa Torlonia is the place to be. If you sleep with the window open the sun will gentle wake you and make you alert to the blackbird song. We very much enjoyed walking in the park and smelling the linden trees in the evening. Wonderful! And all of this just across the street from the hotel. The great villas in the neighborhood also worth a tour. Especially the ones on Via Dora. Great architecture! No complaints about the room. It was cleaned every morning, it had comfortable mattress and a nice marble bathroom. English speaking personal will give you information on the closest restaurants and also maps for every occasion, tourist attractions, great gellateria or nearby streets to find the easiest way back. And all just 15 minutes walking from Termini station and 5-10 minutes from the metro station. enjoy,

Reviews.Title: “not a bad base”
Reviews.Author: sarah36
Reviews.Content: we've just come back from a three night stay at the Villa Torlonia and while it feels a little down on its luck, this isn't a bad place to stay. The area that the hotel is in is pretty nice - large old villa's, many of which appeared to be embassies or ministerial institutes. It is a walk from the centre of town so if you're eating out at night its a real schlep (alot of it uphill) back. It is a very short walk from the metro..I'm unsure of exact times but this was shut by ten at night. The rooms are on the small side and the carpet had seen better days..but they were clean and it was relatively quiet which was a blessing after the noise of central Rome. The staff were friendly and helpful if slightly stressed and the barman/hotel taxi driver gave us a lift to the airport for forty euro's which was a bit of a bargain. Beware of the taxi's at the train terminal - we were charged 34 Euro's to the hotel which was a complete rip off. Altogether this is not a bad place to stay for the money but if you don't fancy a 40 minute treck uphill in the wee hours then I'd give it a miss.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: ana_Bucharest
Reviews.Content: Hotel Vila Torlonia was my home for 10 nights and I like that very much. The rooms are clean, the towels are changed every day, the air conditioning was working perfectly, the breakfast was good and the staff was ok. Not very friendly but I didn't ask for that. The neighborhood was very safe, quiet, and convenient to Polyclinico Metro Station as well as some bus routes. With bus nr. 62 you could get down town in a minute. I was very happy with the services and I received much more quality that what I expected. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly delightful”
Reviews.Author: lisaamoran
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed very much my 1 week stay at Hotel Villa Torlonia. Staff was friendly, helpful and accommodating; neighborhood was safe, quiet, and convenient to Polyclinico Metro Station as well as some bus routes. (And I am a single woman traveling alone.) Reasonably priced restaurants also nearby. Room was basic but certainly comfortable, 2 twin beds with private bathroom; all facilities were more than adequate and breakfast was also quite good. Only 2 small problems: had difficulty getting outside phone lines; heat went out in room 2nd night but I was promptly moved to another, larger room. Despite these issues, I received much more quality that what I expected for the price, and I would definitely stay there again!
